events.message: The customer reported a car accident that occurred on April 30th involving a collision with another vehicle at an intersection.
The claim was reviewed by the intake team and categorised under Auto Accident due to the involvement of a personal vehicle collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to assist the customer throughout the claim process, promising detailed support and prompt updates.
An official acknowledgement was sent to the customer confirming receipt of the accident claim and summarizing next steps.
The customer was asked to provide copies of the police report, photos of vehicle damage, and insurance card to proceed with the investigation.
The customer submitted all requested documents including detailed accident photos, official police report, and contact details of the other driver.
The claims team initiated the investigation to validate the damage claims and assess liability based on submitted evidence.
Investigation concluded with confirmation that the other driver was at fault, and damages incurred are covered under the policy.
A settlement offer was proposed to the customer covering vehicle repair costs and rental car expenses during the repair period.
The customer provided positive feedback expressing satisfaction with the claim handling process and timely settlement proposal.
The claim was formally approved by the claims adjuster pending payment processing for authorized repairs and costs.
Payment was issued directly to the approved repair shop as well as reimbursement for the rental vehicle fees.
The claim file was officially closed after confirmation from the customer that repairs were completed and all payments received.
The closed claim was archived in the records management system for future reference and regulatory compliance.
